meanings.sent1: She preferred the practical and realistic approach, so she was considered antiromantic.
meanings.sent2: The movie had a dark and antiromantic atmosphere, lacking any romantic elements.
meanings.sent3: His antiromantic views on love made him the subject of many jokes among his friends.
meanings.sent4: In a world of fairy tales, she stood out like an antiromantic storm cloud.
meanings.sent5: The artist's antiromantic style captured the harshness of reality in a unique way.

meanings.definition: Not characterized by or conducive to romance.
meanings.sent1: Their relationship was purely practical and antiromantic.
meanings.sent2: The office environment was strictly professional and antiromantic.
meanings.sent3: The antiromantic setting of the restaurant made it perfect for business meetings.
meanings.sent4: The city's architecture was cold and antiromantic, lacking any charm.
meanings.sent5: The antiromantic decor of the room gave it a minimalist and modern feel.

meanings.definition: A person who is against romantic ideals or sentiments.
meanings.sent1: She was known as an antiromantic among her friends who believed in true love.
meanings.sent2: The author portrayed the character as a cynical antiromantic in the novel.
meanings.sent3: The antiromantic often teased his friends for being too sentimental.
meanings.sent4: In a room full of romantics, he stood out as the lone antiromantic.
meanings.sent5: The antiromantic's speeches against love always sparked heated debates.
